abstract: Tyler Kepner On Baseball Column contends that despite strained left groin and persistent pain, Texas Rangers outfielder Josh Hamilton remains a batting threat in the World Series.
snippet: In his first three at-bats, Josh Hamilton had a broken-bat grounder to short, a fly out to left and a strikeout, before driving in the tying run in the ninth inning.
lead_paragraph: In his first three at-bats, Josh Hamilton had a broken-bat grounder to short, a fly out to left and a strikeout, before driving in the tying run in the ninth inning.

headline.main: Hamilton Is Playing the Postseason in Pain
headline.print_headline: Hamilton Chips In While Playing in Pain
headline.seo: Hamilton Is Playing the Postseason in Pain
